sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
A similar WhatsApp-based remittance project exists, but it is still in very early development and not tailored to Indonesia. TrustBridge focuses on Indonesia specifically, where WhatsApp dominates daily communication and cross-border transfers remain costly and inefficient.



Beyond simple chat-based transfers, TrustBridge integrates multi-stablecoin swaps, instant currency conversion, and a dual interface (WhatsApp + web dashboard) designed for Indonesian users. This combination of local-market focus, decentralized settlement, and practical UX has not been introduced in Indonesia.



As an Indonesian team building for Indonesian users, we hold a clear advantage in localization, user trust, and early adoption.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Our MVP will demonstrate core chat-based remittance features, including sending, receiving, and converting funds directly through WhatsApp, plus a web dashboard for clearer balance and transaction management. It will show stablecoin transfers, basic KYC flow, and instant currency conversion.



The prototype can be accessed through a WhatsApp chatbot link and a public web demo page.

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer: Success will be measured by active users completing real remittance transactions, total transaction volume, and stablecoin flow recorded on-chain. Key indicators include monthly active senders/receivers, number of completed cross-border swaps, total value locked in user balances, and average transaction cost reduction. Growth in repeat transactions and user retention will validate product-market fit in Indonesia.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
TrustBridge enables Indonesians to send and receive cross-border remittances directly through WhatsApp, the country’s most widely used messaging app. Instead of relying on slow, expensive traditional remittance services, users interact with a simple chatbot to transfer funds, convert currencies, and receive stablecoins instantly.



By integrating Cardano-based stablecoin rails and automated swaps, TrustBridge cuts transfer fees, speeds up settlement, and removes the need for bank intermediaries. The WhatsApp-first experience eliminates app-installation barriers and makes digital remittances accessible for everyday users, especially migrant workers and families who rely on fast, low-cost transfers.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
TrustBridge introduces a practical use case for Cardano by bringing blockchain technology into one of the most widely used communication channels in the world: WhatsApp. By enabling cross-border transfers through a Cardano smart contract, the project can create steady on-chain activity supported by a market that has not been well served by current financial services.

According to the United Nations Network on Migration, there are around 9 million Indonesians living and working abroad. (Source: UN Network on Migration, “Indonesia Terms of Reference” document. [https://migrationnetwork\.un\.org/system/files/docs/Indonesia%20UN%20Migration%20Network%20\-%20Terms%20of%20Reference\_final\.pdf](https://migrationnetwork.un.org/system/files/docs/Indonesia%20UN%20Migration%20Network%20-%20Terms%20of%20Reference_final.pdf) ).



This population drives a large remittance flow that reaches billions of dollars each year. Even a small share of this activity can bring new users into the Cardano ecosystem, increase transaction volume, and show that Cardano can function as a reliable settlement layer for global payments. TrustBridge also highlights how blockchain can be used to address real financial problems in emerging markets, which may encourage more developers to build similar solutions on Cardano.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
# **Why this team can deliver**


**Operational base: Early MVP on WhatsApp \+ Web Interface**

The team behind this project already operates a functional early prototype accessible through WhatsApp and a simple website. Even though it is still under development, it demonstrates the core workflows:

- Users join cooperative (koperasi/arisan) groups,
- Funds are recorded transparently,
- Automated draws and decision-making are simulated,
- User actions are logged and traceable.

The team has hands-on experience in:

- Web3 product design,
- DAO governance structures,
- Smart contract integration on EVM chains, and
- User-focused workflows for financial coordination.

This foundation allows rapid conversion from prototype to on-chain system once funding is secured.



**Relevant background & ecosystem alignment**

The proposer has experience in:

- Leadership and project management within student organizations,
- Organizing and running multi-stakeholder events,
- Developing digital products and coordinating team workflows,

This gives the team a practical grounding in how people behave in group financial systems, how trust breaks down, and what infrastructure actually solves it.



**Community and education experience**

The project lead is actively involved in:

- Web3 development challenges (e.g., hackathons),
- University-based tech communities,
- Discussions around decentralized governance and transparency.

The team can also leverage existing student and youth communities for rapid testing, feedback, and user education.

This real-world access to early adopters provides a unique advantage for iterating fast and validating assumptions.

# **Feasibility of Scope**
A structured 6-month timeline is realistic to:

- Finalize the system’s smart-contract logic,
- Integrate DAO voting and Chainlink VRF for fair draws,
- Refine the WhatsApp and web interface for mainstream users,
- Conduct pilot programs with real cooperative/arisan groups,
- Gather usage data, improve UX, and produce a final playbook + report.

Requested budget is used for core development, security reviews, pilot operations, and user validation. The scope avoids heavy infrastructure costs and focuses on delivering a functional, reliable, transparent cooperative system.



# **Validation of Approach**
Feasibility will be validated through clear, verifiable outputs:



Operational Proof

- Logs of real cooperative/arisan cycles run on the prototype
- User onboarding data, participation rates, and completion statistics
- Interaction records from WhatsApp workflows and web interface



On-chain Verification

- Smart contracts deployed to testnet and mainnet
- On-chain governance votes
- Chainlink VRF executions (arisan draw randomness)
- Transparent treasury movements and DAO-led decisions

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
**Total requested:** 15,000 ADA

**Duration:** 6 months

**Approximate breakdown:**



**1\. System Architecture, Compliance, and KYC Setup – 3,000 ADA**

• Technical architecture documentation for chatbot, backend, database, and smart contract

• Integration preparation with Privy for KYC and a licensed Indonesian payment gateway

• Compliance alignment for remittance flows and user data handling

• Drafting user flows and communication templates for WhatsApp interactions



**2\. Core Development \(Chatbot, Backend, Smart Contract\) – 6,000 ADA**

• Development of WhatsApp chatbot and message automation

• Backend API implementation

• Smart contract development for stablecoin settlement

• Sandbox testing with KYC provider and payout partner

• CI and deployment configuration for test environments



**3\. Pilot Testing and User Validation – 4,000 ADA**

• Onboarding of Indonesian workers abroad for pilot testing

• Supervised test transfers across WhatsApp

• User research, feedback collection, and flow refinement

• Monitoring setup for transfer speed, error rates, and payout reliability

• Small operational costs for coordination with pilot participants



**4\. Launch Preparation and Playbook Production – 2,000 ADA**

• Refining chatbot responses and improving user guidance

• Finalizing risk checks and operational procedures

• Producing a public-facing playbook documenting flows, lessons, and guidelines

• Preparing onboarding instructions, FAQs, and short helpful content

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
**For 15,000 ADA, the Cardano ecosystem gains:**



• A working WhatsApp-to-Cardano remittance channel serving a real global community

• A verified technical model showing that Cardano can handle cross-border settlement in an accessible way

• A tested onboarding flow for Indonesian workers abroad, one of the largest remittance populations in Southeast Asia

• An operational KYC and payout structure that future Cardano payment projects can adopt

• A reusable playbook that documents architecture, compliance considerations, user flows, and lessons from the pilot



Compared with the cost of typical payment pilots or remittance integrations, this is a lean request that directly targets a high-value use case: fast, fair, and low-cost remittance for migrant workers.



**If successful, TrustBridge can:**



• Demonstrate how stable-value transfers on Cardano can serve underserved communities

• Provide a template for future financial inclusion products in emerging markets

• Reduce barriers to onboarding real-world users who rely on simple communication channels like WhatsApp

• Show DReps, voters, and Cardano builders that the treasury can support products that deliver daily, practical utility



TrustBridge is a small, focused investment aimed at proving a valuable Cardano payment model that can scale across the Indonesian migrant community and beyond.
